sense.name: to hunt snipe
sense.examples: Every summer my father and I would snipe in the marshes. Jenny and I snipe yearly, whether we shoot one or not. David has fond memories of sniping with his cousins.

sense.name: sharpshoot
sense.examples: The most formidible enemy is the one sniping from the rooftops. Soldier snipe the field to clear it for their comrades. Gunmen who are taught to snipe have extra skills.

sense.name: attack, assault verbally/in writing
sense.examples: The editors of the paper sniped the new house speaker for laziness. The scathing review sniped all the so-callede 'do-gooders'. The Truth ad campaigns snipe the cigarette companies.
